definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: And that night in the ladies' room of the Rustler Steak House, he chose me.
sentences.chinese: 那一晚，在那家牛排馆的女厕所里，他选了我。

sentences.english: That is when I go to a steak house.
sentences.chinese: 这是当我去一家牛排馆。

sentences.english: Hello, Mother, would you like to go to Tony's tomorrow night for dinner?
sentences.chinese: 喂，妈，妳明天晚上想不想去东尼牛排馆吃晚饭？

sentences.english: We were almost kicked out of the steak house when my boss's dog jumped up onto the table.
sentences.chinese: 我老板的狗跳上桌子时，我们差点被踢出牛排馆。

sentences.english: Kevin: The new steak house around the corner is finally open, You wanna go there this weekend?
sentences.chinese: 街角处的新牛排馆终于开张了。这个周末有兴趣去吗？

definition: Japanese cuisine (abbr. for 日本料理[Ri4 ben3 liao4 li3])
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish
